title: Percy Hickey
text:
Percival "Percy" Hubert Hickey (28 April 1899 – 21 December 1943) was a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who represented the <a href="All%20blacks">All Blacks</a> in 1922. His position of choice was <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions">wing three-quarter</a>.
Career.
Hickey was born in <a href="Rahotu">Rahotu</a> in 1899. He made the provincial side in 1919.
He was selected for the North against South Island match in 1922. He scored a try. He was then selected for the national side on their <a href="1922%20New%20Zealand%20rugby%20union%20tour%20of%20New%20South%20Wales">tour of New South Wales</a>.
Hickey played in two of the possible five matches. He played both of these games out of his regular position. In his second match against New South Wales, Hickey was judged to have committed an obstruction offence and conceded a penalty try. This was considered a part of the 14-8 defeat.
Hickey did not again play for Taranaki nor be chosen for the All Blacks.
However, in 1925 Hickey moved down to <a href="Wellington">Wellington</a> and joined the Poneke club. He made the provincial team that same year.
He later moved further south to <a href="Dunedin">Dunedin</a> and then <a href="Double%20Bay%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Double Bay</a>, Australia.
Personal.
Hickey's wife's name was Winnifred. She worked as a barman in Wellington.
